intro: Elaphrium karwinskii, commonly known as the Karwinski's lily, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. It is closely related to other members of the Liliaceae family, sharing similar structural and reproductive features. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
